title: Rice harvest
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Indians of North America - Canada - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Indigenous peoples - Canada
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Food supply - Political aspects
description: Each fall, for generations, the families of the Pauingassi band have camped by northern Manitoba lakes, and combed the reedy shores with brooms, paddles and baskets for manomin - wild rice. The trade with the bush pilot begins the process by which an Indian staple and sacred crop becomes a white man's luxury food. A quiet but haunting film.
